content.question: Which statement best describes the approximate global distribution of coal supplies?

choices.label: Brazil and South Africa together contain 33% of proven reserves.
The United States contains 40% of proven reserves.
Australia, Japan, and France together contain 45% of proven reserves.
The United States, the former Soviet Union, and China together contain 50% of proven reserves.
Germany, Brazil, and India together contain 75% of proven reserves.

content.answer: The United States, the former Soviet Union, and China together contain 50% of proven reserves.
